Module kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem
Package kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem.controller.products

Class ModifyProductController

java.lang.Object
kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem.controller.products.ProductsController
kline.qkmii.inventorymgmtsystem.controller.products.ModifyProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class ModifyProductController extends ProductsController
Controller class to handle modification of an existing Product. Inherits from the base class ProductsController. Given a Product object, copies information about product to be injected into the corresponding FXML fields. Upon a save event, calls a validation method and updates the product in Inventory.
Author:
Timothy Albert Kline

  • Constructor Details

    • ModifyProductController

      public ModifyProductController(Product selectedProduct)
      Controller constructor specifying a product to modify. Provided a Product object, calls fetchProductInfo to store information about the product. Creates a new ProductBuilder using the product to be updated. Initializes formLabelTitle to be pre-injected into FXML
      Parameters:
      selectedProduct - the product to be modified. Cannot be null
      See Also:
      • ProductsController.formLabelTitle
      • fetchProductInfo(Product)
      • initialize(URL, ResourceBundle)
      • ProductBuilder(Product)

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      Injects Product information into FXML fields. The current Product's information fetched during the constructor instantiation is injected into the loaded FXML fields. Calls super method to finish the rest of the initialization.
      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Overrides:
      initialize in class ProductsController
      Parameters:
      url - url
      resourceBundle - resource bundle

    • handleSaveBtnEvent

      public void handleSaveBtnEvent(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws Exception
      Handles saving a modified product. Calls validateInput() to verify user inputs are correct before updating product in Inventory.allProducts. Calls createProduct to replace product being modified with its updated data. Returns to menu view if succeeds.
      Specified by:
      handleSaveBtnEvent in class ProductsController
      Parameters:
      event - save button click. To redirect back to menu.
      Throws:
      Exception - if error flagged from validateInputs(). Prevents update of product in Inventory.allProducts
      See Also:
      • ProductsController.validateInputs()
      • SceneManager.returnToMenu(ActionEvent)
